Case reference: 2014002239.CaseDesc: On the August 24, 1993, Cynthia-Ann Peddle, commonly known as Cindy Paddle, was seen for the last time in Sept-Îles, Quebec. There is a possibility that Cindy frequented the area of Vieux Quai in Sept-Îles before her disappearance.

Pants: Denim, Blue, Faded Jeans, thigh pockets
Vest: Red, Pink, T-Shirt, Pink or red

Case reference: 2014001591.CaseDesc: On September 5, 1997, Gordon Mertz was seen for the last time at the Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) on East White Hills road in St. John's, Newfoundland. Gordon worked as a Fisheries Scientist, and records show that he logged off of his computer and left the building shortly after 5:15 p.m.

Case reference: 2024035450.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2024, the body of this unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River in the United States.

Hair: Black, Bald, Short, Short facial hair, black and grey

Case reference: 2005005699.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1991, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River between Horseshoe Falls and the "Maid of the Mist" boat docks. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 113 lbs, however this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He had signs of having suffered an acute or chronic right lung infection. He is estimated to have been dead for several months. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is either of European ancestry, or South Asian ancestry, or mixed European and South Asian ancestry.

Teeth: Several amalgam fillings in his teeth and multiple posterior teeth in his upper and lower jaw were lost/removed prior to death.

Case reference: 2013000003.CaseDesc: On September 4, 2011, James "Jamie" Lee was camping with several friends at the Smoky Flats Campground. Jamie was last seen by friends during the early morning hours when he went for a walk by himself.

Case reference: 2013000074.CaseDesc: Pasquale Giannetti has been missing from Montreal since November 26, 1984. His vehicle was located at L'Ile Ste-Hélène and his clothes were found on the Jacques Cartier Bridge.

Case reference: 2014002608.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1998, Jong Donohue was seen for the last time as he departed from Camrose, Alberta. It is possible that Jong may have had plans to travel to Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014004460.CaseDesc: Tsuguo Moroto left his place of business in Banff and rented a car on July 21, 1985. Several days later the vehicle was located at Panther Falls on Highway 93 North near Lake Louise, Alberta.  Several ground, aerial and waterway searches were conducted without success. Tsuguo was never located.

Case reference: 2006000399.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1988, the body of a Caucasian male was recovered from the Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 132lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Auburn, Bald, Wavy, Balding in front, sideburns and unshaven with several days growth
Teeth: Many amalgam fillings, 1 composite resin restoration. Missing multiple upper and lower posterior teeth prior to death.
Belt: Leather, Brown, Size 34, with gold buckle & "Genuine Olde English Leather" written on the inner portion
Jeans: Blue, "Renée de France" Brand, size 34" waist and 34" inseam
Money: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Canadian coins $2.26, one American dime
Fractured/Broken Bones: Healed fracture, noticeable bump on the middle of his right collarbone.

Case reference: 2013000018.CaseDesc: On November 17th, 2010, Varaporn Toassami left Canada with her daughter, Chonticha Galamae Ellefson-Toassami in contravention of a family Court Order.  They travelled to Thailand, where it is believed they still are today.  Varaporn Toassami has been charged with child abduction under Section 282 of the Criminal Code.  There is a warrant for her arrest.

Case reference: 2011000699.CaseDesc: On 23 May 1985, William Drake walked out of the Pinecrest Home for senior citizens, where he lived.  He was last seen at 9:30 am walking eastbound on highway 17 in Kenora, near the Sunset Husky gas station.  His family and friends have not heard from him since. Mr. Drake is reported to be hard of hearing and diabetic.

Pants: Light Blue, small checks and suspenders

Case reference: 2015020897.CaseDesc: In April of 2015, Delmer Paul Bonnetrouge was seen for the last time in Fort Providence, Northwest Territories. He was reported missing by his family.

Case reference: 2014005835.CaseDesc: Dexter Whitford was last seen April 29, 2004 by family in Edmonton, Alberta.  Dexter has tattoos on both his hands, a tear drop under his right eye and a buffalo skull with the name "Stella" on the right side of his neck.

Tattoo: Right Side Of Neck, Buffalo with "STELLA" inside

Case reference: 2021009119.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2021, Amber Ellis was reported missing by her mother. Amber communicated with her friends and family, including her two children, on a regular basis prior to her disappearance. During the time of her disappearance, Amber was leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Scar: Left Thigh, Scar from a stab wound

Case reference: 2008000799.CaseDesc: On August 26th, 1986 Terry FIELD and Linda BLACKWELL left Lost Nation Airport, east of Cleveland, Ohio en route to Brantford Municipal Airport, Brantford, Ontario.  The plane was 18 minutes into its flight when the pilot communicated with Cleveland Air Traffic Control that they were encountering severe turbulence.  They requested new vectors to fly. The pilot was advised to turn west, then Air Traffic Control lost radio and radar contact with the plane. Debris from the plane was located on August 27, 1986 in Lake Erie, approximately 32 nautical miles south of the St.Thomas Airport. Debris was drifting in a southeast direction and was recovered approximately 1-3 nautical miles on the Canadian side of the international boundary line in Lake Erie. Debris was identified by Bud FIELD,  brother of Terry FIELD, as having come from the missing aircraft.

Case reference: 2014003363.CaseDesc: At 2:00 a.m. on April 21st, 1992, Hilda BEAUDOIN and her brother left the Beagle Lounge in Mary's Harbour, NL on a single snowmobile to ride across the sea ice near coastal waters in efforts to return to St. Lewis, NL. They did not arrive at their destination. Snowmobile tracks were discovered leading into open water near St. Lewis where the snowmobile and her brother's body were later recovered from the ocean waters.

Case reference: 2013000081.CaseDesc: On May 21, 1995, John Kargakos was reported missing when he was last seen swimming by a neighbour in Lac St-Louis au bord de l'eau located in the Dorval district of Montreal, Quebec. John has Alzheimer’s disease.

Case reference: 2016061228.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1970, a male was found floating in Lake Ontario near the mouth of the Humber River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 201lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to several days.

Shoes: Black, only the left shoe has laces

Case reference: 2019032078.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2019, at aprroximately 2:19 pm, Shauranne Humphry was seen for the last time at the Anduhyaun Shelter in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004813.CaseDesc: Germain Gaudreault was seen for the last time on August 26, 2006, around noon in the area of the municipality of Baie Ste-Catherine, Quebec. He was alone in his 1997 white Plymouth on Highway 138 eastbound. His unoccupied vehicle was found later that evening on the wharf of the municipality of Les Escoumins.

Tattoo: Chest, Blue dot for medical treatments

Case reference: 2020008878.CaseDesc: On September 19, 1979, Joseph Vetere was seen for the last time in the area of 1061, Weston Road in Toronto, Ontario.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, A penny with the initials "T.W."
Left Upper Arm, Bear on a rock

Case reference: 2014002458.CaseDesc: On September 4, 1986, Rozebeh Kiani was seen for the last time in the Shaughnessy Village district of Montreal, Quebec. Rozebeh left all his personal belongings behind in his apartment and it is possible he may have travelled to Vancouver, British Columbia. Rozebeh speaks very little French or English.

Case reference: 2015054218.CaseDesc: On September 19, 2015 Heather Coburn was last seen in the area of Prospect Point, Niagara Falls, New York, United States. At the time of her disappearance, Heather was despondent.

Foreign Object: Right Hip, Pins in right hip
Right Jaw, Dental implant in upper jaw

Case reference: 2014005508.CaseDesc: In October 2010, Maxime Jacques left Winnipeg, Manitoba by bus to visit family in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. On October 30, 2010, Mr. Jacques never arrived at his destination and his family reported him as missing.

Case reference: 2018063233.CaseDesc: On March 4, 1994, at approximately 10:00pm, Stanislawa ‘Mary’ Jurkiewicz last spoke with her family. It is believed that the following morning, Mary left her residence in the area of Fern Avenue and Roncesvalles Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004628.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2005, Patrick Marshall was last seen when he left his residence in the North East area of Jean Cote, Alberta. Patrick had left a note indicating that he would be travelling to Calgary with a friend. The note also indicated that he would be in contact within a few weeks. When he left, Patrick left with minimal clothes and toiletries.

Hair: Brown, Short, Dark brown, turning grey

Case reference: 2014005624.CaseDesc: Heinz Paul was last seen filling his vehicle with gas in Calgary, Alberta then driving west. Police investigations regarding Mr. Paul's whereabouts are currently ongoing.

Case reference: 2008021099.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1966, Diane Prevost was seen for the last time as she was camping at Grundy Provincial Park in Britt, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Diane had been playing on the beach, and had told her father that she wanted to go back to the campsite. When her father turned to do so, she was gone.

Shirt: Blue, Red, checked top with red at cuffs and collar

Case reference: 2014003376.CaseDesc: Paula Wade was last seen leaving a hospital in St. Catharines, Ontario on November 25th, 1979. The next day, her abandoned vehicle was located in a parking lot in Niagara Falls, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance, Paula was despondent

Coat: Dark Blue, Orange, Ankle length navy coat with orange hood
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, Ring, With red birth stone
Scar: Abdomen, Large scar up to breasts

Case reference: 2014003382.CaseDesc: On May 27, 1988, Stanley Umpherville and a friend were driving to The Pas, Manitoba where they stayed the night. In the morning the two departed The Pas via a 20 foot yawl with the intent on going to Easterville. They departed the Umpherville settlement around 1300hrs and they briefly stopped at Pine Bluff around 1600 hrs. It is believed they then stopped at a friend's trappers cabin at Rat Hunting and ate a meal. The last thing the survivor remembers, is seeing the lights of Easterville and he crawled to the front of the boat where he fell asleep. He awoke around 0500 hrs the next day and Stanley was no longer in the boat and he was adrift. Numerous islands and shorelines in the area were searched, and several air and water patrols were made without success. Stanley has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Hat: Grey, Baseball style with "Hi Ho Hi Ho" on front

Case reference: 2012020167.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from Burrard Inlet. He was previously discovered as a stowaway on the vessel S.K. Junior that originated in Ningbo, China on March 15th, 1997 and arrived in Vancouver April 4th, 1997.

Teeth: Stained, Poor oral hygiene and forensic analysis identified many unique characteristics in his dentition.
Jacket: Synthetic, Blue, Red, blue and white track suit jacket with stripes down the sleeves

Case reference: 2014001139.CaseDesc: On August 4, 1974, the skeletal remains of a teenage boy were discovered under a log near Lost Lagoon in Stanley Park, Vancouver, British Columbia. He was believed to have died at least a year before his discovery.

Pants: Corduroy, Dark Blue, Button fly pants
Sweater: Synthetic, Dark Blue, Turtleneck, Knitted turtleneck sweater

Case reference: 2022032399.CaseDesc: On May 25, 2022, partial skeletal remains of this man were found in a forested area near Salmon Arm, British Columbia. He had a severe fracture to his right lower leg during life, which required surgical intervention. He likely died many months to years before his remains were found.

Foreign Object: Right Leg, fracture to right tibia with surgical implant

Case reference: 2023005753.CaseDesc: On January 1,1970, Anne Moran was last seen by her husband in their residence in Toronto, Ontario.  It was believed by her family that her husband reported her missing however no report can be located.  Her husband has since passed away.

Case reference: 2014003643.CaseDesc: Dean Mortensen was reported missing on January 24, 1992, after he failed to attend his classes at the University of Alberta in Edmonton, Alberta. Dean was last seen by his friends leaving the on campus bar, The Ship. They parted ways with him within 200 metres of his dorm room at the St. Joseph's College that night.

Jacket: Grande Cache Bantam Elks leather hockey jacket with gold shoulders, white collar, "Dean" on sleeve
Shirt: ST JOSEPH, St. Joseph crest on front

Case reference: 2014005412.CaseDesc: On March 2, 2010, Ian Murray was seen for the last time as he left the Mental Health Unit at the Cape Breton Regional Hospital in Sydney, Nova Scotia. During the time of his disappearance, Ian was suffering from schizophrenia and had stopped taking his medication.

Case reference: 2016070415.CaseDesc: On December 2, 2016, Houda Doumi left Canada with her two children, Zineb and Rayan Lahrim and connected at the John F. Kennedy Airport in New York City, USA, where they then travelled on to Cairo, Egypt. It is believed that Houda and the children are actually in the United Arab Emirates.

Case reference: 2005004699.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1995, an unidentified woman was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist Dock. She had adenomyosis, similar to endometriosis. She had peach/pink polish on finger and toe nails. She is estimated to have been in the water for a few days.

Teeth: Good condition with a few white fillings. Both lower first molars were extracted before death.
Jeans: Denim, Blue, Levi's Strauss, size 27 waist and 22 inseam
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, wearing a 14" chain with crucifix; European 9K gold; manufacturing mark of "ATS"
Scar: Abdomen, 12 cm surgical scar below the naval

Case reference: 2012020114.CaseDesc: Sebastien Metivier went missing in Montreal, Quebec on November 1, 1984. The young boy was in front of the Tres-Saint-Nom-de-Jesus church on the east side of the city and he was heading to an arts and crafts course.

Pants: Blue, Patch on the right knee

Case reference: 2014001859.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1997, Wendy Ratte was reported missing by her daughter. Mrs. Ratte was last seen on August 18, at 3pm. Her vehicle was found, locked, in a grocery store parking lot. Investigations led to a conviction in 2010, however her remains have yet to be located.

Case reference: 2014003280.CaseDesc: On July 7, 1998, Peter Dekoning was reported missing after failing to return home from making his restaurant deliveries. He was last seen at Jackfish Lake near Two Hills where he was believed to have stayed for several days. His vehicle was located near the North Saskatchewan river with the keys missing. There was no sign of foul play. A search of land and water was unsuccessful.

Pants: Dark Blue, Black, pants were either dark blue or black
Scar: Jaw, long white scar down right side of chin

Case reference: 2014005573.CaseDesc: In November/December 1976, Vernon Loiselle was visiting family in an Edmonton, Alberta hospital. Vernon left the hospital and hasn't been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005105.CaseDesc: On May 11, 2001, at approximately 8:00 p.m., Younes Taleb was seen for the last time at his mother’s business in Toronto, Ontario.

Mark: Cheek, Mole on the right cheek

Case reference: 2019040153.CaseDesc: On July 4, 2019, Shae-Lynn McAllister was seen for the last time at 10:30 pm leaving work at the A&W restaurant in Fairview, Alberta.

Case reference: 2007005699.CaseDesc: Henry Pegahmagabow was last seen in the area of the Kipling Hotel on August 15, 1962.  His boat was found the next morning in the Parry Sound Harbour.  It is believed that he may have drowned in an attempt to return to Parry Island.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2005004599.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1996, an unidentified man, believed to be Caucasian was recovered from the Sir Adam Beck Dam in the Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 145 lbs and his length was measured at 5'10" to 5’11”, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He has evidence of heart disease and may have had heart problems in the past. It is estimated that he had been in the water for a few days up to two weeks prior to discovery. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts that this unidentified male is of European ancestry.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Long, Long grey and white beard 12cm
Teeth: No upper teeth and no lower posterior teeth; remaining teeth have roots only; crowns are lost due to decay.

Case reference: 2012020038.CaseDesc: Desiree Oldwoman was last seen near her home on the Siksika Fist Nations Reserve near Gleichen, Alberta. She is autistic and does not speak, although she can write her name. Ms. Oldwoman was last seen on August 27, 2011.

Case reference: 2013000006.CaseDesc: Joseph Taylor was last seen leaving his residence around midnight on July 30, 2001. He left his residence in a despondent state. It is believed he has started a new life and possibly a new identity for himself in the area around Kelowna in British Columbia. He may be working as a general labourer.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Sword with snake around (5cm)

Case reference: 2016055037.CaseDesc: Human remains were found on May 10, 2006 in a field near Mossleigh, AB. They are believed to be those of a female, over the age of 40, possibly of Caucasian or Indigenous descent, who was between 5’2” and 5’6”. The individual was missing teeth and likely wore an upper denture. The individual may have complained of joint pain due to arthritis. The remains appear to have been there from 1 to 5 years.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Cheek, Healed fracture of right cheek bone
Mark: Right Side Of Head, Large button osteoma on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2024040019.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2024, hunters found the body of this female in the woods at the end of a culvert in Coaticook, Quebec, close to border of Vermont and New Hampshire, United States of America. The victim was wearing several pieces of clothing including a toque, winter coat, jeans, wool stockings, winter boots. An autopsy was performed and the probable cause of death is likely due to environmental hypothermia.

Sweater: Blue, White, Long sleeve, "Old Navy" brand

Case reference: 2008003699.CaseDesc: Gary Anderson and his wife Dawn were camping and fishing on Kilburn Lake in Woodland Caribou Provincial Park.  Mr. Anderson went out fishing on the lake alone in his canoe and never returned. A search by land, water and air turned up only a fishing lure and a hat.

Case reference: 2021014455.CaseDesc: On January 20, 2018, Sonya Manning was seen for the last time in Buffalo, New York State. Sonya’s vehicle was located in close proximity to the falls in Niagara Falls. During the time of her disappearance, she was despondent.

Tattoo: Left Ankle, A butterfly or flower
Right Ankle, A butterfly or flower
Forehead, Turquoise jagged edges at hairline

Case reference: 2022014037.CaseDesc: On March 23, 2022, Roger Vidito was seen for the last time as he left his residence in the west-end of Ottawa, Ontario. Roger grew up on the east coast of Canada, and there may be a possibility that he travelled there.

Case reference: 2005002599.CaseDesc: On October 21, 1989, an unidentified man was discovered in the area of County Road 14 in Napanee, Ontario.  Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts that this man was of south Asian ancestry.

Shirt: White, DRESS, Brand: Pierre Cardin; grey, blue, and red thin stripes

Case reference: 2009004999.CaseDesc: At the time of her disappearance, Dawn Carisse was a patient of the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital. She is generally very pleasant though suffers from short term memory loss due to cardiac arrest several years earlier.  Dawn Carisse always spoke of leaving the hospital and going to where she believed her family would be. Her family was in the Kirkland Lake area and then moved to Sudbury. She was aware of both, and her possible destinations were Kirkland Lake or Sudbury. She was last seen on Highway 11 North, in North Bay, Ontario.

Hair: Brown, Curly, Parted in centre, short bangs
Dress: Maroon, Pink, Long dress with faint white flowers, short sleeves and front buttons.
Luggage: May have had a dark duffle bag in her possession.

Case reference: 2018000324.CaseDesc: On October 6, 2006, Freda Whiteman was seen for the last time at the York Hotel in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2009003699.CaseDesc: Michel Gagich, who typically goes by his middle name: Steve, was last seen by his father on Saturday, September 5, 2009 at his residence in Hamilton.  He left his residence on Sunday, September 6, 2009 in the morning, around 8:00 a.m. without speaking to his parents.  He left a note indicating that he was leaving for the weekend. Mr. Gagich's vehicle was located on Tuesday, September 8, 2009 at approximately 7:15 p.m. when a passing airplane observed a fire.  By the time the fire department arrived the vehicle was completely burned.  The vehicle was located in a remote area on Emmett Lake Road in St. Edmund's Township.  Mr. Gagich was last seen at the Tobermory Ferry Terminal on Wednesday, September 9, 2009 at 7 a.m.  It is not known if he purchased a ticket to board the ferry.  The MS Chi Cheemaun ferry provides transportation for vehicles and people from Tobermory to South Baymouth on Manitoulin Island.

Hair: Brown, Short, Dark, receding hair line; Moustache, Sideburns

Case reference: 2014001028.CaseDesc: The body of this middle aged man was found in the Fraser River near Quesnel, British Columbia on May 20, 1968. He was well dressed and had custom orthotic supports in his shoes. He would have been born around 1920, had grey hair and likely had full dentures.

Other: Case, Leather case with nail clippers
Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Pen Knife, Pen Knife
Leather, Black, Small key case with 15 keys
Shoes: Leather, Black, Pointed dress shoe with Dr.Scholl's arch support insole
Wallet: Brown, Light brown leather wallet with dark brown stitching

Case reference: 2019010367.CaseDesc:
Simeon Bear was last seen on July 23, 1982 when he was last seen boating on Reindeer Lake,
heading out from Southend, Saskatchewan to Lawrence Bay during a storm.

Deformity: Right Hand, Disfigured index, middle and ring fingers

Case reference: 2014004742.CaseDesc: On January 9, 2006, Michael James Bosma left on foot from a care home located on Bernard Avenue in Kelowna, BC and failed to return.  Mr. Bosma had been diagnosed with schizophrenia and required essential medication.  ATM activity was recorded on his account during the night and early morning hours following his departure then all traces of him ceased.

Case reference: 2006024499.CaseDesc: Allan MacKenzie was last seen in Chapleau, Ontario on November 5, 1987. He was making a delivery with his red and green tractor/trailer to the Ministry of Natural Resources in Chapleau and then believed to be enroute to Toronto, Ontario. He was subsequently reported overdue in Toronto and has not been seen since. His trailer and tractor were located, parked north of Sultan, ON.

Case reference: 2016064705.CaseDesc: On May 14, 1995, a partial skull was found on the bank of the North Saskatchewan River, north of Derwent, Alberta. The individual had likely been deceased for more than 5 years

Case reference: 2014001102.CaseDesc: On March 4, 1973, the remains of a young adult man were recovered from the Burrard Inlet in Vancouver, British Columbia. He carried a Canada flag pocket knife and is believed to have been in the water for several months prior to the discovery.

Case reference: 2018070318.CaseDesc: In the summer of 1983, Angela Hartmann left home to travel to Ottawa, Thunder Bay, and Calgary before attending fall classes at Trent University in Peterborough, Ontario. It is believed that Angela's last known location was in August of 1983 in Ottawa, Ontario at the Ottawa Youth Hostel.

Case reference: 2006009399.CaseDesc: Patrick Ukrainetz departed his mother's house in St. Isidore, Ontario which he did periodically, but always returned.  On December 26, 2001, Mr. Ukrainetz was captured on a video surveillance camera at a bank in St. Sauveur, in the Province of Quebec. There has not been any other activity on the bank account since that time and he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2012020104.CaseDesc: On Saturday, April 15, 2006, Francis Albert-Cloutier was seen for the last time at his home located in Saint-Marc-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. His vehicle, a black 2001 Chrysler Intrepid was found on the following day by a passerby on an ATV trail in Saint-Amable, Quebec. No one has since seen or heard from Francis.

Jewelry: Gold, A ring with colored stone on each middle finger

Case reference: 2014002878.CaseDesc: On February 26, 2001, Albert Fare was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Albert was despondent.

Scar: Neck, Surgical; back of the neck

Case reference: 2014001059.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1970, the body of a heavyset young adult male with black hair was found on the shore of Kamloops Lake in British Columbia. He had all his teeth removed during his life and had no noticeable scars or tattoos. He is believed to have drowned in the Thompson River near Riverside Park a few days earlier.

Jacket: Nylon, Light Blue, Squall brand with hood, golfer label on front with zipper
Shirt: Blue, Yellow, Corsair brand, checkered pattern
Blue, Longsleeve, Lancer Brand, Size Large, Blue with purple and black check pattern, longsleeve
White, Bluestone brand, long sleeves, size medium
Shoes: Brown, Oxfords, Vibram brand, made in Italy, with shoe laces

Case reference: 2022001740.CaseDesc: On December 26, 2021, Gonzalo Rubi last spoke with his family and friends. Gonzalo’s bank card was last used on December 28, and his abandoned vehicle was subsequently located in a neighbourhood in London, Ontario, on January 15, 2022.

Tattoo: Right Hand, Cuba across the fingers

Case reference: 2008245047.CaseDesc: Jadon may be in the company of his non-custodial mother Roxana Eliana YANEZ PARADA.

Case reference: 2014005152.CaseDesc: Anker Ljunggren was a farm hand who worked in Yellow Grass, SK. Anker was last seen in October, 1935, by his wife. He was working in Craik or Craven, SK but was heading north to find more work and was never seen or heard from again.

Case reference: 2014005499.CaseDesc: During the early morning hours of Friday, October 1st, 2010, Janice Cher Desjarlais and her boyfriend crawled into a dumpster located behind The Center of Hope on Franklin Avenue in Fort McMurray. Janice's boyfriend advised that he left at approximately 7:30 a.m. to go to McDonald’s restaurant. When he returned at around 8:30 a.m., Janice was gone. When he was unable to find her, he suspected that the dumpster may have been emptied during his absence. On October 3rd, video surveillance of the area confirmed that the dumpster had been picked up at 8:22 a.m. on October 1st. It also showed the departure of Janice's boyfriend, but no one else entering or leaving the dumpster. On October 5th, a major excavation of the landfill was started, but by the time the search was completed on October 14th, Janice had not been located.

Case reference: 2005000899.CaseDesc: On April 21, 2005, a Caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 29 and 50, was found in a wooded area on the embankment of a small creek off Queen Street in Bobcaygeon, Ontario. There are indications that this person suffered from early age-related osteoarthritis. It is believed that this individual had likely been at this location since 1994 or earlier.

Case reference: 2012020122.CaseDesc: Robert Bishara was last seen during the evening of March 17th, 2009 in Brossard, Quebec. At the time of his disappearance, he was driving a black 2006 Chevrolet Trailblazer 2006 bearing Quebec licence plate 941TBA. The car has not been located. Robert originates from Egypt and no one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2013000114.CaseDesc: Abigail Andrews, a single Metis woman, lived in a basement suite in Fort St. John. She worked at FSJ Fashions, and The Frontier Bar and Grill. She was pregnant but not yet showing. Abigail was last seen on the evening of April 7, 2010 walking from her home towards a friend's house.

Teeth: Good, Used a dental pallet retainer
Deformity: Right Index Finger, Previously broken and healed in a deformed position

Case reference: 2014004726.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1992, Brenda Wilson was last seen at her residence in Moncton, New Brunswick. She lived alone and all of her personal belongings were left behind. At the time of her disappearance, Brenda was despondent.

Case reference: 2014005708.CaseDesc: On October 9, 1959, Martin Kenny and his cousin rode an Algoma Central Railway freight train from Sault Ste. Marie to Hawk Junction, Ontario, to visit his parents. The train came to a stop in Eton at Mile 120, leaving the train car they were riding in behind. Martin failed to reboard the train and was left behind. Martin was last seen in Perry, Ontario, on October 10, 1959. He stopped for water before walking north along the railroad tracks. He was never seen again.

Case reference: 2012020651.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1984, Patricia Favel was seen for the last time in the downtown area of Regina, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014005838.CaseDesc: Dale Jackson was last seen on June 28, 2010 in Edmonton, Alberta.  Dale left behind all his personal belongings including his cell phone.

Case reference: 2023062205.CaseDesc: Kevin HIPFNER was seen for the last time on November 10, 2023, in rural Barrhead, Alberta. Kevin left home driving his father's vehicle.  The vehicle was located near a lake, to date Kevin has not been located.

Case reference: 2014004294.CaseDesc: On May 28, 2001, Jean-Paul Leroux was seen for the last time when he left his spouse’s residence in Montreal, Quebec.  His vehicle was located abandoned 7 days later in the parking lot of the Saint-Leonard shopping centre. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004181.CaseDesc: On July 2, 1984, Yves Jodouin was seen for the last time as he was dropped off at a venue in Ottawa, Ontario. Yves had received permission to leave the Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario to attend a show. Later that evening, he had phoned his family to advise he would be running late.

Case reference: 2016068711.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1969, an unidentified male was found 0.8 kilometres west of Sioux Lookout. His death appears to be self-inflicted

Case reference: 2014005921.CaseDesc: On June 19, 2012, at approximately noon, Diane Bonneau was seen for the last time at her residence in Saint-Félicien, Quebec. Diane hasn’t been seen and we haven’t heard from her since.

Case reference: 2014003001.CaseDesc: Mr. Westbrook was last seen during the late afternoon/early evening hours on September 8, 1994. Mr. Westbrook had stopped at the Highwayman Restaurant located at 3001 Highway 11 North to gas up a motor home as he was attempting to return to Strathroy, Ontario. Family members had followed him in their vehicle and took away his keys to prevent him from driving any further as they were concerned about his driving. After a confrontation with his family members he was last seen walking southbound on Highway 11 in an agitated state. He was observed walking and hitchhiking heading towards the city of North Bay, ON. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2022037048.CaseDesc: On June 20, 2008, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from Lake Erie, approximately one mile off the north end of Woodlawn Beach in Buffalo, New York.

Jacket: Dark Blue, Brand: Carhartt; size: small
Sweater: Blue, Sweatshirt with cut off sleeves
Blue, Pullover sweater; brand: Mountain Exxpedition

Case reference: 2016069642.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1995, the remains of a woman were discovered near Carbon, Alberta. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 10 and 15 years. The individual had dental restorations including stainless steel crowns.

Case reference: 2014004372.CaseDesc: Patrick-Jean De Loppinot was last seen on September 11, 2003, at a friend's residence in Laval. He was supposed to go home but never arrived. He left with a black 1990 Volkswagen Jetta registered in Québec. At the time of his disappearance, Mr. De Loppinot lived with family in Longueuil. He was reported missing by his family.

Case reference: 2018010996.CaseDesc: On February 25, 2018, at approximately 11:00pm, Ilya Platonov was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Ilya did not attend school the next morning.

Case reference: 2014004547.CaseDesc: Ervin Moar is transient in nature and is known to frequent the Main Street strip of Winnipeg, MB. Mr. Moar has not been seen or heard from since June 3, 2004.

Case reference: 2006005399.CaseDesc: In October 1956, Charles Ombash and his brother Tom Ombash left the Pelican Falls Residential School. They had planned to canoe back to Cat Lake, or alternately take the train to Savant Lake, get a ride to Pickle Lake, and then canoe to Cat Lake. Their family has not seen them since.

Case reference: 2014002117.CaseDesc: On January 13, 1996, Michelle Harmer was reported missing by an acquaintance of the family who last spoke with her on October 31, 1995. The last contact Michelle's family had with her was in early November 1995.

Case reference: 2014005156.CaseDesc: On October 15, 2002, Jeanne Ouellette was seen for the last time at a Starbucks coffeehouse in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016041364.CaseDesc: Tony Olekas was last seen on July 21, 2016 when he was mushroom picking at Big Sandy Lake, Sasketchewan.

Case reference: 2014005236.CaseDesc: On May 30, 1973, Françoise Guilbault reportedly left her home in Joliette, Quebec. She left a note for her husband and took a bus to Montreal. She has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2018063463.CaseDesc: During the last week of November in 1992, Slavko Orasnin was seen for the last time by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006020999.CaseDesc: Ivan Matthews was last seen when witnesses saw his sailboat out of control approximately one mile off shore near the Sand Islands in Lake Superior. It is presumed Mr. Matthews fell overboard.  He has not been seen since.

Deformity: Left Foot, club foot, sometimes uses crutches
